DataElement.preferredName: EQ-5D-5L Questionnaire v1.0 6 VAS Health State Today Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of their health state today, using a visual analogue scale (VAS) resembling a thermometer to assign a numeric value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: European Quality of Life Five Dimension Five Level Questionnaire Health State Thermometer Scale Your Health State Today
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient._A scale marked off like a thermometer from 0 to 100 that is used to help people indicate how good or bad their health state is; the best state that can be imagined is marked 100 and the worst state that can be imagined is marked 0_A question asking an individual about how good or bad they rate their own health today.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Question Instruction
ReferenceDocuments.description: We would like to know how good or bad your health is TODAY. This scale is numbered from 0 to 100. 100 means the best health you can imagine. 0 means the worst health you can imagine. Mark an X on the scale to indicate how your health is TODAY. Now, please write the number you marked on the scale in the box below.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Medidata ePRO CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This CDE has been validated for use with the Medidata Rave ePRO module.
